alert.note: Alert for Latah (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 7:09PM MDT until June 14 at 7:10PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Washington... Palouse River near Potlatch affecting Latah and Whitman Counties. For the Palouse River...including Potlatch...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Palouse River near Potlatch. * WHEN...Until Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, Water will be up to the back door at the city shop in Palouse. Water will approach the home on Main St near Hayton Greene Park. Lions Club Park in Palouse will be submerged and water will be around the playground at the Hayton Greene Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 PM PDT Monday the stage was 15.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:45 PM PDT Monday was 15.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is currently in minor flood stage and quickly rising toward moderate flood stage of 16.0 feet. The river is expected to crest near 16.3 feet overnight then begin to recede on Tuesday. - Minor Flood stage is 15.0 feet. Moderate Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.5 feet on 01/17/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 700 AM PDT.
